text: Kim Tu-bong (March 16, 1886 â€“ 1958) was a Korean linguist, politician, and the first North Korean head of state. ==Career== In 1946, Kim became Chairman of the Workers Party of North Korea.Lankov, Andrei "Kim Tu-bong and Historical Linguistics," The Korea Times (ROK). September 2, 2007; retrieved 2012-7-24. From 1948 until 1958, he was Chairman of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly. ==References== Category:1886 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Prime ministers of North Korea
title: Kim Tu-bong
